Review Text: I loved this movie. The dance scenes were so  beautiful ,  delicate, and powerful. What an incredible view of Lisa and Patrick's love for each other even behind their characters. We have truly lost very special actor and human being. It must be a beautiful film for Lisa to watch over and over again
Review Title: Very beautifully done
Rating: 5.0

I have seen this several times, and it's still one of my favorite movies of all time. The age we live in is often so full of meaningless things , and love is often put aside. This film captures the heart and much more. It's a story of struggles that anyone can endure, child, teen, adult and senior.....finding meaning and love again.
Amazing film that gives you faith in humanity

A Bird of the Air
Margaret Whitton  (Director, Producer),     Rachel Nichols  (Actor),     Jackson Hurst  (Actor)    &                   0                  more   Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Romance
["A stray parrot brings together Rachel Nichols and Jackson Hurst in an adaptation of Joe Coomer's romantic novel The Loop, directed by Margaret Whitton. Lyman (Hurst) is a quiet loner who works the overnight shift for the Highway Courtesy Patrol. When a talking parrot flies in to his trailer he becomes obsessed with tracking down its previous owners, which leads him to Fiona (Nichols), a librarian who speaks her mind. Together, the pair set off to unravel the past as Fiona opens up Lyman's heart."]

profile:
**User Summary:**

The user exhibits a strong appreciation for films and shows characterized by authentic storytelling that elicits a broad spectrum of genuine emotions. Recent interactions reflect a preference for lighthearted narratives, complemented by an enduring interest in gripping dramatic tales centered on love and personal growth. With an impressive average rating of 4.8, the user clearly values high-quality productions that deliver engaging content.

In a recent review, the user awarded a perfect score to a film, praising its beautiful dance scenes and the heartfelt portrayal of love between the lead characters, which sparked a reflection on the legacy of a beloved actor. This emphasis on emotional resonance further reinforces their commitment to narratives that inspire and uplift. 

The user continues to favor English content and appreciates subtitles for enhanced narrative engagement. Their reviews highlight a keen awareness of the collaborative nature of filmmaking, with recognition given to directors and producers alike. The user consistently seeks films that blend sweet, enjoyable stories with deeper emotional complexity, positioning them as a thoughtful film critic. 

Overall, the user's profile illustrates a discerning taste for high-quality cinematic experiences that resonate personally and emotionally, while remaining open to both lighthearted and impactful storytelling.
